topic.title: Disable Caching in WebHelp Classic Output

body.p: In cases where a set of WebHelp Classic pages need to be updated on a regular basis to deliver the latest version of the documentation, the WebHelp pages should always be requested from the server upon re-loading it in a Web browser on the client side, rather than re-using an outdated cached version in the browser.

To disable caching in WebHelp Classic output, follow this procedure:
Locate the following template in the XSL file: <xsl:template name-"create-toc-common-file"> and add the following code snippet:<meta http-equiv="Pragma" content="no-cache" /> <meta http-equiv="Expires" content="-1" />The code should look like this: <html> <head> <xsl:if test="$withFrames"> <base target="contentwin"/> </xsl:if> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8"/> <!-- Disable caching of WebHelp pages in web browser. --> <meta http-equiv="Pragma" content="no-cache" /> <meta http-equiv="Expires" content="-1" /> ....
Save your changes to the file.
Re-run your WebHelp system transformation scenario.
